result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick S Statham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

No violent contact with: victim G.M. or anyone else listed in the criminal complaint.  Domestic Violence Counseling/Anger Management through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Derrick S Statham in court with Attorney Robert J Penegor.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Penegor makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: victim G.M. or anyone else listed in criminal complaint 
____Domestic Violence Counseling/Anger Management through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha;


COSTS:  $343.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($150.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED to be used at agent's discretion
